posts.name: Pete Walters
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.74 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • If you’re in the middle of writing a message, now that thread will appear at the top of your chat list so it’s even easier to craft the perfect draft.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.73 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.74.0.960-beta

51 new commits since 7.73.0.956-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.74 [1]

  • Asyncify image blurring methods [2]

  • Update profile pic button on iOS 26 [3]

  • Update comment to reflect asyncification changes [4]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.57.0 [5]

  • Rename Attachment.transitTierInfo->latestTransitTierInfo [6]

  • Dismissing views and rapidly swiping back freezes UI [7]

  • OWSProgress improvements [8]

  • Remove a few verbose warnings [9]

  • Privatify wasCancelled setter [10]

  • Treat SignalError.chatServiceInactive as expected [11]

  • Remove share extension web socket remote config [12]

  • Clean up sender certificate validation warnings [13]

  • De-dupe sender certificate fetches [14]

  • Remove redundant background tasks [15]

  • Recover if AppAttest suddenly rejects a previously-attested key [16]

  • Don't make HEAD requests for each thumbnail download [17]

  • Only download thumbnails if optimization enabled [18]

  • Don't schedule backup BGProcessingTask if not registered [19]

  • Add ci_pre_xcodebuild.sh to download Metal toolchain manually [20]

  • Add originalTransitTierInfo to back up <45d old forwarded attachments for free tier users [21]

  • Remove LazyDatabaseMigratorRunner kill switch [22]

  • Log whether we're on wifi or cellular after a reachability change [23]

  • Delay PNI pre key operations during change number [24]

  • Make rebuildIncompleteViewOnceIndex blocking [25]

  • Persist newly-linked device before contact sync [26]

  • Move Copy to Clipboard button in RecordKey into pinned footer [27]

  • Track nanosecond durations for per-frame export times [28]

  • Fix stories tab being cut off after showing keyboard [29]

  • Hold a background task assertion when registering [30]

  • Asyncify generatePniIdentity [31]

  • Add more info to backup attachment download logging [32]

  • Remove _RegistrationCoordinator_PreKeyManagerShim [33]

  • Use transitionCoordinator for navigation completion handlers [34]

  • Show call info by default on calls tab tap [35]

  • Update join call nav bar button on iOS 26 [36]

  • Allow full-page pop gestures on iOS 26 [37]

  • Run completion handler immediately when navigation is not animated [38]

  • Download progress bar jumps to 100% immediately [39]

  • Don't block all attachment offloading and backup export on failed thumbnail [40]

  • Present WelcomeToBackupsSheet in viewDidAppear [41]

  • Move push token request to the web socket [42]

  • If a user skips entering PIN during reg, ask after reg [43]

  • Add 'spqr' device capability to iOS devices. [44]

  • Log error when the donation UX dismisses with an error [45]

  • Glass payment option buttons [46]

  • Use web socket for Quick Restore [47]

  • Use clampedNanoseconds in retryDelayNanoSeconds [48]

  • Properly memory-manage output data in NonceHeaderInputStreamTransform [49]

  • Fail requests quickly after being deregistered [50]

  • Update translations [51]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.73.0.956-beta…7.74.0.960-beta

Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.
Because nobody wrote a new one, I guess

Yes, but it would be the least effort to do and beta testers would know what to watch.
Even a “regular bug fixes” would be better, than keep the old one there.
Absolutely agree - we’re on the same page

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: It seems to me that the changelogs are adding support for new theming on iOS26, but I don’t see anything new (l’m on the iOS26 dev beta). Is it under a flag I can’t access or something?

If I understand it correctly, iOS26 design elements will have to be exported using xcode 26. But, developers may not/cannot use those before the release canditate iOS26 beta. It looks like they are making the app ready for it, but the effects will only show up when they use xcode 26.

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: Ah yeah I heard that too. I’ve seen other app betas already implement it (forscore…) but I suppose that’s because they’re not planning any App Store releases until iOS26 release.

posts.name: Daniel Azuelos
posts.cooked:
I’d like to join your group of testers.
I am on iOS and installed Testflight.
When starting it, Testflight request me to enter a RedeemCode :

Testflight Redeem code739×1600 61.4 KB

How do I get such a Redeem code?

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: This is correct – we’re still working on our iOS 26 support, and aren’t yet releasing builds made with Xcode 26.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Please see the instructions here, which will point you to the our public TestFlight invite link here.

link_counts.title: Join the Signal - Private Messenger beta - TestFlight - Apple

posts.name: Daniel Azuelos
posts.cooked:
Thank you @sashaweiss-signal,
This is exactly the way I proceeded,
which lead me to the request of a Redeem code,
which I still don’t guess how to get .

Should I run a specific version of iS to use Testflight?
Should I run a specific version of iOS to beta test Signal?

I feel the request of a Redeem code from Testflight could be more clear.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.73 release

posts.cooked:
Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.75 release.
